skill.name: project-knowledge
skill.description: Load project architecture and structure knowledge. Use when you need to understand how this project is organized.
skill.summary: Load project architecture and structure knowledge. Use when you need to understand how this project ...
skill.author: Clouder0

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Only permits the Read tool to access knowledge files. No network, file writing, or code execution capabilities. All 15 static findings are false positives triggered by benign JSON field names and documentation strings that do not represent actual security risks.

content.value_statement: AI assistants often lack context about project structure and conventions. This skill provides organized access to architecture, patterns, and gotchas so assistants understand how components connect and follow established practices.
actual_capabilities: Access common code patterns from memory/knowledge/codebase/patterns.json
Retrieve known gotchas and pitfalls from memory/knowledge/codebase/gotchas.json
Follow structured format for knowledge updates after discoveries
Merge new knowledge updates after task completion
limitations: Only reads knowledge files, does not create or modify them directly
Depends on existing knowledge files being present in memory/knowledge/codebase/
Cannot access project files outside the knowledge directory
Knowledge updates are merged only after task completion, not in real-time

use_cases.title: Quick project onboarding
use_cases.description: New team members understand project structure and coding standards quickly through organized knowledge files.

use_cases.title: Better context for AI
use_cases.description: AI assistants gain project-specific context to provide more accurate and relevant code suggestions.

use_cases.title: Consistent design choices
use_cases.description: Team members reference established patterns when making architectural decisions to maintain consistency.

prompt_templates.title: Load architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Load the project architecture knowledge file to understand how this project is structured.

prompt_templates.title: Check conventions
prompt_templates.prompt: What coding conventions should I follow for this project? Load the conventions file.

prompt_templates.title: Find patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: What patterns are used in this codebase? Show me the patterns file.

prompt_templates.title: Avoid pitfalls
prompt_templates.prompt: What gotchas should I be aware of in this project? Load the gotchas knowledge file.

output_examples.input: Load the project architecture knowledge file.
output: Architecture Overview: This is a multi-agent development system with tiered agent hierarchy
Key Directories: .claude/ for agent configs, memory/ for state and knowledge
Agent Tiers: Tier-1 (PM, architect, executor) can spawn subagents; Tier-2 (explorer, implementer, verifier) are focused workers

output_examples.input: What coding conventions should I follow?
output: Naming: Use snake_case for variables, PascalCase for types
Formatting: 2 spaces for indentation, trailing commas allowed
Testing: Write unit tests for all new functions

output_examples.input: What gotchas exist in this project?
output: The database connection pool requires explicit cleanup
Config files are loaded from environment, not local overrides
Avoid using the legacy authentication module for new features

best_practices: Load relevant knowledge files before starting tasks to understand project context
Update knowledge files when discovering new patterns, conventions, or gotchas
Use the structured JSON format for knowledge_updates with appropriate confidence levels
anti_patterns: Starting work without loading relevant knowledge files
Failing to document discovered gotchas for future reference

faq.question: What tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill supports Claude, Codex, and Claude Code AI assistants.

faq.question: What is the maximum file size for knowledge files?
faq.answer: Knowledge files have no strict size limit but should remain focused for quick loading.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing workflows?
faq.answer: Load knowledge files at the start of tasks using the Read tool with the @memory/knowledge path.

faq.question: Is my project data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads files you explicitly specify. No data is sent externally.

faq.question: Why are my updates not visible immediately?
faq.answer: Knowledge updates are merged after task completion to maintain consistency across sessions.

faq.question: How is this different from general documentation?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-specific, structured knowledge formatted for optimal assistant understanding and action.
